Parts of it are legitimately awful. However, there are actually a lot of really, really beautiful places hidden away. The view from the Sacramento Mountains down to White Sands around midnight with a full moon? It is gorgeous. The big area north and east of Silver City holds some really, really neat dirt, gravel, and off-road trails with some cool views. The high grasslands and mountains of the north-central part of the state are a cheaper version of Colorado, but no less pretty.

Culturally, it's pretty crap overall, but there are some good people here and there.
